HTML.Description: A skill tree covering various aspects of HTML mastery.

HTML Basics.Description: Covers the foundational elements of HTML.

Subitems.Description: Understanding the basic structure: <html>, <head>, <body>.

Using common tags:

,

-

,
, , , .
Proper use of attributes: id, class, href, src, alt.
Nesting elements correctly and understanding document flow.
Working with basic text formatting tags: <b>, <i>, <u>, <strong>, <em>.

Semantic HTML.Description: Focuses on writing meaningful and structured HTML.

Subitems.Description: Understanding the purpose of semantic tags.
Using structural tags: <header>, <footer>, <main>, <section>, <article>, <nav>.
Employing inline semantics: <time>, <mark>, <abbr>, <cite>, <q>.
Differentiating between <div>/<span> and semantic equivalents.
Designing a layout with semantic meaning in mind.

Forms and Validations.Description: Focuses on creating and validating forms.

Subitems.Description: Creating basic forms with <form>, <input>, <textarea>, <button>.
Working with form attributes: action, method, target, autocomplete.
Understanding input types: text, password, email, number, date, file, checkbox, radio.
Utilizing form validation attributes: required, pattern, min, max, maxlength, step.
Building forms with accessible error messages and labels.

Accessibility.Description: Ensures web content is accessible to all users.

Subitems.Description: Adding alternative text to images (alt attribute).
Structuring content for screen readers with role and ARIA attributes.
Using accessible navigation techniques: tabindex, skip links.
Creating focus states and ensuring keyboard navigability.
Structuring content for readability with proper heading levels and landmarks.

Media Integration.Description: Focuses on integrating and optimizing media content.

Subitems.Description: Embedding images with and understanding responsive images: srcset, sizes.
Adding audio with <audio>.
Adding video with <video>.
Using <picture> for advanced responsive images.
Working with iframe content using <iframe>.
Understanding the implications of media performance (lazy loading, formats).

SEO Fundamentals.Description: Covers foundational techniques for search engine optimization.

Subitems.Description: Structuring pages with <title> and <meta> tags.
Using headings <h1>-<h6> properly for content hierarchy.
Creating canonical URLs and avoiding duplicate content issues.
Adding Open Graph and Twitter Card metadata.
Using structured data (<script type="application/ld+json">) for rich results.

Advanced HTML Techniques.Description: Explores advanced concepts and techniques in HTML.

Subitems.Description: Creating and using <template> and <slot> for web components.
Implementing custom data attributes (data-*).
Using <dialog> for modals and interactive elements.
Understanding shadow DOM and encapsulation basics.
Applying best practices for future-proof HTML.

CSS.Description: A skill tree covering mastery of CSS for web design and development.

CSS Basics.Description: Covers the foundational elements of CSS.

Subitems.Description: Understanding the syntax: selectors, properties, and values.
Using basic selectors: type, class, ID, universal (*)
Applying common properties: color, background-color, font-size, margin, padding, border.
Understanding the box model (content, padding, border, margin).
Linking CSS to HTML using <link> and <style>.

Selectors Mastery.Description: Focuses on mastering CSS selectors for precise styling.

Subitems.Description: Using combinators: descendant ( ), child (>), adjacent sibling (+), general sibling (~).
Mastering attribute selectors: [type='text'], [type^='a'], [type$='z'], [type*='e'].
Working with pseudo-classes: :hover, :focus, :nth-child(), :nth-of-type().
Leveraging pseudo-elements: ::before, ::after, ::marker.
Writing specific and efficient selectors to avoid conflicts.

Box Model and Layout.Description: Explores layout fundamentals and the CSS box model.

Subitems.Description: Understanding width, height, max-width, max-height, min-width, min-height.
Controlling overflow: overflow, overflow-x, overflow-y.
Applying box-sizing for predictable dimensions.
Using margins, padding, and borders effectively.
Clearing floats and understanding block vs. inline elements.

Typography.Description: Covers font and text styling techniques.

Subitems.Description: Setting font properties: font-family, font-size, font-weight, font-style.
Controlling text spacing: letter-spacing, line-height, word-spacing.
Aligning text with text-align and vertical-align.
Applying decorative styles: text-transform, text-shadow, text-decoration.
Using web fonts with @font-face or services like Google Fonts.

Positioning.Description: Focuses on positioning elements on the page.

Subitems.Description: Mastering position values: static, relative, absolute, fixed, sticky.
Controlling z-index and stacking context.
Using top, right, bottom, left to position elements.
Combining positioning with transforms.
Understanding relative positioning contexts for nested elements.

Flexbox.Description: Covers CSS Flexbox for creating flexible layouts.

Subitems.Description: Defining flex containers and items: display: flex.
Aligning items: justify-content, align-items, align-self.
Wrapping elements: flex-wrap and flex-flow.
Controlling proportions: flex-grow, flex-shrink, flex-basis.
Building layouts with cross-axis and main-axis alignment.

Grid Layout.Description: Explores CSS Grid for advanced layouts.

Subitems.Description: Setting up grids with display: grid.
Defining grid tracks: grid-template-rows, grid-template-columns.
Placing items with grid-area and shorthand notations.
Aligning items: align-content, justify-content, place-items.
Using grid gaps and fr units for spacing.

Responsive Design.Description: Covers techniques for creating responsive web designs.

Subitems.Description: Understanding and using media queries: @media.
Creating fluid layouts with percentages, vh, vw, and calc().
Working with breakpoints for different screen sizes.
Using min, max, and clamp() for responsive scaling.
Combining Flexbox and Grid for adaptive layouts.

CSS Variables and Custom Properties.Description: Focuses on leveraging custom properties in CSS.

Subitems.Description: Declaring and using custom properties: --main-color, var(--main-color).
Defining variable scopes (global vs. local).
Creating dynamic themes with variables.
Combining variables with calc() for advanced styling.
Managing fallback values for older browsers.

Advanced Styling.Description: Covers advanced styling techniques and effects.

Subitems.Description: Creating transitions with transition and easing functions.
Animating elements with @keyframes and animation.
Applying filters: blur, brightness, contrast, drop-shadow.
Using clipping and masking: clip-path, mask.
Implementing parallax effects with background properties.

Preprocessors and Frameworks.Description: Explores preprocessors like Sass/SCSS and frameworks like Bootstrap.

Subitems.Description: Understanding the syntax of preprocessors like Sass/SCSS or Less.
Using nested rules, variables, mixins, and partials.
Compiling preprocessors into CSS.
Leveraging utility classes with frameworks like Tailwind or Bootstrap.
Integrating preprocessors or frameworks into a build pipeline.

JavaScript.Description: A skill tree covering mastery of JavaScript for web development.

Learn the Basics.Description: Covers foundational JavaScript concepts and syntax.

Subitems.Description: Understanding var, let, and const for declaring variables.
Covers string, number, boolean, null, and undefined.
Using if, else, switch, and loops (for, while).
Understanding type coercion and differences between == and ===.
Working with function declarations, expressions, and arrow functions.

DOM Manipulation.Description: Focuses on interacting with and modifying the Document Object Model.

Subitems.Description: Using document.querySelector and getElementById to select DOM elements.
Using innerHTML, textContent, and setAttribute to modify content.
Adding and removing elements dynamically in the DOM.
Using addEventListener and understanding event propagation.
Working with styles and classes programmatically.

Fetch API and Asynchronous JavaScript.Description: Covers asynchronous programming with the Fetch API and Promises.

Subitems.Description: Using fetch to perform HTTP requests.
Understanding then, catch, and finally for handling asynchronous actions.
Writing asynchronous code with async and await.
Handling errors in API calls effectively.
Parsing JSON responses and working with API data.
Understanding event listeners and handlers.
Managing user interactions like clicks, input, and keypress.
Learning bubbling, capturing, and delegation.
Using CustomEvent for creating custom events.
Building interactivity through event-driven logic.

ES6+ Features.Description: Covers modern JavaScript features introduced in ES6 and later.

Subitems.Description: Using template literals for dynamic string creation.
Destructuring objects and arrays for cleaner code.
Using the spread and rest operators (...).
Organizing code using import and export modules.
Using optional chaining (?.) for safe property access.

VersionControl.Description: A skill tree covering mastery of version control using Git.

Version Control Basics.Description: Covers foundational concepts and commands in Git.

Subitems.Description: Understanding the purpose of version control (tracking changes, collaboration).
Initializing a Git repository (git init).
Cloning repositories (git clone).
Viewing changes with git status and git diff.
Staging and committing changes with git add and git commit.

Branching and Merging.Description: Focuses on creating and managing branches in Git.

Subitems.Description: Creating branches with git branch, git checkout, or git switch.
Merging branches with git merge.
Resolving merge conflicts manually.
Viewing branch history and structure with git log --graph.
Deleting branches locally with git branch -d.

Collaboration with Remotes.Description: Covers working with remote repositories for team collaboration.

Subitems.Description: Connecting to a remote repository with git remote add origin.
Pushing changes to remotes with git push.
Pulling changes from remotes with git pull.
Fetching updates without merging using git fetch.
Understanding the difference between fetch and pull.

Undoing Changes.Description: Focuses on undoing and reverting changes in Git.

Subitems.Description: Undoing staged changes with git reset.
Reverting commits with git revert.
Resetting to a previous commit with git reset --hard.
Viewing commit history with git log.
Checking out specific commits or files with git checkout.

Advanced Topics.Description: Explores advanced Git topics for experienced users.

Subitems.Description: Using .gitignore to exclude files.
Stashing changes with git stash and applying stashed work.
Cherry-picking specific commits with git cherry-pick.
Working with tags (git tag) for versioning.
Understanding and using rebase (git rebase) to simplify history.

React.Description: A skill tree covering mastery of React for building web applications.

React Basics.Description: Covers foundational concepts for setting up and building React applications.

Subitems.Description: Setting up a React project using create-react-app, Vite, or manual setup with Webpack.
Understanding JSX syntax and embedding expressions in components.
Creating functional components in React.
Using props to pass data between components.
Rendering lists and handling basic events like onClick and onChange.

State and Lifecycle.Description: Focuses on managing state and understanding component lifecycle in React.

Subitems.Description: Managing local state with the useState hook.
Using useEffect for side effects like fetching data and subscriptions.
Understanding component re-rendering and dependency arrays.
Sharing data across components by lifting state up.
Cleaning up effects to prevent memory leaks.

Component Composition and Reusability.Description: Covers techniques for composing and reusing components effectively.

Subitems.Description: Composing components by nesting and reusing them.
Using the children prop to create wrapper components.
Writing controlled and uncontrolled components, such as forms.
Understanding prop drilling and using alternatives like the context API.
Creating reusable custom hooks for shared logic.

React Router.Description: Focuses on implementing routing and navigation in React applications.

Subitems.Description: Implementing routing with BrowserRouter, Routes, and Route.
Using dynamic and nested routes in React Router.
Using hooks like useParams, useNavigate, and useLocation.
Creating protected routes with authentication guards.
Handling 404 pages and redirects in routing.

Advanced React.Description: Covers advanced React concepts for optimization and better performance.

Subitems.Description: Optimizing performance with React.memo, useMemo, and useCallback.
Using React.lazy and Suspense for code splitting and lazy loading.
Managing global state with the Context API and useContext hook.
Debugging and analyzing performance with React DevTools.
Understanding the reconciliation process and React 2019s virtual DOM.
